DataElement.preferredName: OME TIFF Image File Directory Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of image file directory (IFD) sections in an Open Microscopy Environment (OME) tagged image file format (TIFF) file header storing microscopy information (pixels and metadata).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: OME Tagged Image File Format Image File Directory
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tagged image file format (TIFF) image file format that contains an Open Microscopy Environment (OME) XML metadata block in the file header for storing microscopy information (pixels and metadata) using the OME Data Model._A section of a Tag Image File Format (TIFF) file where the first two bytes state the number of fields that the image file directory contains, followed by a sequence of 12-byte field entries, and then the final 4 bytes give the offset to the next image file directory (IFD) from the start of the header. There must be at least one IFD in a TIFF file and each IFD must have at least one entry.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Open Microscopy Environment Tagged Image File Format
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tagged image file format (TIFF) image file format that contains an Open Microscopy Environment (OME) XML metadata block in the file header for storing microscopy information (pixels and metadata) using the OME Data Model.

Concepts.longName: Open Microscopy Environment Tagged Image File Format
Concepts.definition: A tagged image file format (TIFF) image file format that contains an Open Microscopy Environment (OME) XML metadata block in the file header for storing microscopy information (pixels and metadata) using the OME Data Model.

Property.preferredDefinition: A section of a Tag Image File Format (TIFF) file where the first two bytes state the number of fields that the image file directory contains, followed by a sequence of 12-byte field entries, and then the final 4 bytes give the offset to the next image file directory (IFD) from the start of the header. There must be at least one IFD in a TIFF file and each IFD must have at least one entry.

Concepts.definition: A section of a Tag Image File Format (TIFF) file where the first two bytes state the number of fields that the image file directory contains, followed by a sequence of 12-byte field entries, and then the final 4 bytes give the offset to the next image file directory (IFD) from the start of the header. There must be at least one IFD in a TIFF file and each IFD must have at least one entry.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
